page.title: 06THE GLASS ENGRAVER
page.content: We visited a glass engraver. The glass that he engraves is mostly lead crystal. It is not like normal glass,which when held from an angle looks a faint yellow. He uses a stylus, a dentists drill and a special compass with a bent point. To engrave on the glass you hold the stylus upright and press, then you engrave. He first dots a picture of what he is doing, then he joins the dots. The dentists drill is for shading large areas. He started engraving from seeing an advertisment in a magazine. Then he tried with some help from an expert. He engraves glasses and jugs for annversaries. He sells most of them by giving out leaflets. Before he was a glass engraver he was a head teacher at a primary school.
